body: # Will ## === Wiimote on linux === Will is a simple program made in python using python-cwiid and python-uinput ( https://github.com/tuomasjjrasanen/python-uinput ) The program is configurable to use the motion plus or the nunchuk as mouse pointer. ## === Use it === 1. install python-cwiid and python-uinput on your system 2. edit config.yml 3. python will.py 4. set permission for udev on your wiimote 4. enjoy your wiimote ## === Configure it === The config.yml contains to parameter * mouse = [motion|nunchuck] * offset = [0-100] * a = [keyboard key for key a] * b = [keyboard key for key b] * up = [keyboard key for key up] * down = [keyboard key for key down] * left = [keyboard key for key left] * right = [keyboard key for key right] * plus = [keyboard key for key plus] * minus = [keyboard key for key minus] mouse is the type of control you want to use, offset is the pixel offset at each movement ## === Set permission for udev === First load the kernel module uinput and assure that you have it in the kernel: **** modprobe uinput then you can put uinput device permission to /dev/uinput **** chmod 0666 /dev/uinput ## === Info === I've created this software cause i'm far from an eletronic shop to buy ir leds and build a irda bar (yes, you can argue me that i didn't use 2 candles for trying, but i'm lazy) I'm very optimist about the motion plus, it's a great piece of hardware to use and to hack. Best use is with a raspberry pi, on board screen and a television, you can browse internet directly from wiimote without a mouse and a keyboard. I'll post soon some videos.
